content: granny shawl by nanita materials used - size 7mm crochet hook - bergere de france sport 7 colours the pattern is written is us terms chain st = chain stitch double_crochet = double_crochet cluster = 3 double_crochet in one stitch/space bergere de france sport is a wool-blend dk yarn the recommended hook size is 4 mm but i used a 7 mm hook i recommend sizing up the hook a bit no matter what yarn you use for nice draping this shawl has a straight edge and a rounded edge you will start with the straight edge the beginning chain can be made as long as you want as long as the chain stitches are a multiple of 3 starting chain i made 192 chain stitches for a shawl with a length of 208 cm 1 st row double_crochet in the 4th chain from hook double_crochet in each chain stitch 2 nd row 3 chain st + double_crochet in the beginning stitch skip 2 3 double_crochet =cluster in the 3rd stitch repeat until the end in the last stitch you work 2 double_crochet you will now have 62 clusters of 3dc one time 3 chain st + double_crochet at the beginning of this row and 2 double_crochet at the end of this row 3 round row add new colour light blue in my shawl chain 3 3dc in the space between all following clusters end with 1dc in the third chain stitch of the previous row you will now have 63 clusters of 3dc 3ch st at the beginning of this row and 1dc at the end of this row 4 th row add new colour denim in my shawl ch3 between the double_crochet and the cluster of the previous row 3dc in the space between all following clusters end with 1dc in between the last two double_crochet stitches you will have now 62 clusters 3 chain st at the beginning of this row and 1dc at the end repeat the 4th row for 11 row you will notice that each row will have one cluster less 16 th row chain 3 1dc in between the last 2 clusters of the previous row 3dc in between each cluster of the previous row end with 1dc between the last 2 clusters of the previous row and 1dc between the last cluster and the 3ch of the previous row you will now have 48 double_crochet clusters on this row repeat this row 16 times until you have 2 clusters left on your last row each row will have 3 clusters less bind off and add a border to your choice i kept my border simple with double_crochet stitches i hope you enjoy happy hooking 
